meanings.definition: A nobleman of the highest rank in the British peerage.
meanings.sent1: The duke lived in a grand castle.
meanings.sent2: The duke attended the royal banquet.
meanings.sent3: The duke's hat was so tall, it almost touched the ceiling!
meanings.sent4: He was a duke in the world of finance, commanding respect and influence.
meanings.sent5: The duke's presence was as imposing as the castle he resided in.

meanings.definition: A male ruler of a small independent state in Italy.
meanings.sent1: The duke governed his small kingdom wisely.
meanings.sent2: The duke's palace overlooked the picturesque countryside.
meanings.sent3: The duke's pet parrot mimicked his every command, much to the amusement of the court.
meanings.sent4: He ruled his land with the authority of a duke, unyielding yet fair.
meanings.sent5: The duke's crown gleamed in the sunlight, a symbol of his sovereignty.

meanings.definition: A title of nobility in some European countries.
meanings.sent1: The duke was addressed as 'Your Grace' by all.
meanings.sent2: The duke's lineage traced back to ancient nobility.
meanings.sent3: The duke's horse, named Sir Galahad, was known for its noble clumsiness.
meanings.sent4: In the world of diplomacy, he was a duke of tact and charm.
meanings.sent5: The duke's portrait hung in the grand hall, a testament to his esteemed title.
